means: （眼）作调节，调节眼球的晶状体（使其变得适应不同距离的物体）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使适合，适应"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: adapt, adjust, conform, accommodate, suit, fit
means: adapt ：指人或物在原有情况下作某些改变以适应新的环境或不同的条件，强调改变的目的和重要性。
adjust与adapt含义很接近，但adjust所改变的幅度要小一些，侧重过程，主要用于调整角度、高度、光点等。
conform ：多指与某模式或规则相符，也引申指改变习惯等以适应新的环境。
accommodate ：书面用词，指以外部条件标准改变自己或某事以求得适应，着重改变或调节的有利。
suit ：指适合要求，从而使人满意愉快。
fit ：含义广，指人或物适合或适应某一目的或用途。

sentence.Network_en: He has never put an arm around his wife to accommodate photographers.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从未为了迎合摄影师而搂住妻子。

sentence.Network_en: Some animal and plant species cannot accommodate to the rapidly changing cond-itions.
sentence.Network_cn: 某些种类的动植物不能适应迅速变化的环境。

sentence.Network_en: There is usually room to accommodate up to 80 visitors.
sentence.Network_cn: 那里通常可以住得下80位来客。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.:from Latin accommodat- 'made fitting', from the verb accommodare, from ad- 'to' + commodus 'fitting'

entry.def: If a building or space can accommodate someone or something, it has enough room for them.

example.ex: The school in Poldown was not big enough to accommodate all the children...
example.tran: 波尔登的学校不够大，容不下所有的孩子。

example.ex: The CD-ROMs will accommodate the works of all English poets from 600 to 1900.
example.tran: 这些光盘能存下从公元600年到1900年所有英国诗人的作品。

entry.def: To accommodate someone means to provide them with a place to live or stay.

example.ex: ...a hotel built to accommodate guests for the wedding of King Alfonso...
example.tran: 一家为接待前来参加阿方索国王婚礼的来宾而建的宾馆

example.ex: Students are accommodated in homes nearby.
example.tran: 学生被安置在附近的住家中。

entry.def: If something is planned or changed to accommodate a particular situation, it is planned or changed so that it takes this situation into account.

example.ex: The roads are built to accommodate gradual temperature changes...
example.tran: 修建这些道路时考虑到了温度的逐渐变化。

example.ex: The way that American history is taught may change in order to accommodate some more of those cultures.
example.tran: 美国历史的授课方式可能会为了照顾到更多的文化而作改变。

entry.def: If you do something to accommodate someone, you do it with the main purpose of pleasing or satisfying them.

example.ex: He has never put an arm around his wife to accommodate photographers...
example.tran: 他从未为了迎合摄影师而搂住妻子。

example.ex: He's already altered several of the proposals in his economic plan to accommodate demands of special interests.
example.tran: 他已经改动了经济计划中的几项提议以迁就特殊利益集团的要求。

entry.def: If you accommodate to something new, you change your behaviour or ideas so that you are able to deal with it.

example.ex: Some animal and plant species cannot accommodate to the rapidly changing conditions...
example.tran: 某些种类的动植物不能适应迅速变化的环境。

example.ex: She walked slowly to accommodate herself to his pace.
example.tran: 她走得很慢，以便与他保持一致的步伐。

means.word_mean: 2. make fit for, or change to suit a new purpose;

sentences.sentence: "Adapt our native cuisine to the available food resources of the new country"

means.word_mean: 3. provide with something desired or needed;

sentences.sentence: "Can you accommodate me with a rental car?"

means.word_mean: 4. have room for; hold without crowding;

sentences.sentence: "The auditorium can't hold more than 500 people"
"We are lodging three foreign students this semester"

means.word_mean: 6. provide a service or favor for someone;

sentences.sentence: "The scientists had to accommodate the new results with the existing theories"

auth_sentence.content: People were willing to accommodate your eccentricities without prejudice.

auth_sentence.res_content: The camp was intended to accommodate eight thousand refugees.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The camp was intended to accommodate eight thousand refugees.

auth_sentence.content: We would need an extra universe to accommodate it.
auth_sentence.res_content: We would need an extra universe to accommodate it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We would need an extra universe to accommodate it.

stems_affixes.word_buile: mod量度,方式,模式,风度+ern..方向的→最近式样
mod量度,方式,模式,风度+est→做事有规矩→礼貌的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有节制的,中等的,适度的,温和的,稳健的
stems_affixes.word_buile: moder=mod量度,方式,模式,风度+ate……的→做事有分度→适度的
out出+mod量度,方式,模式,风度+ed……的→出了时髦[moded时髦的]→不时髦的
modest[adj.谦虚的,有节制的]+y状态→n.谦逊;端庄;羞怯

stems_affixes.value_cn: 模数, 模块, 登月舱, 指令舱
stems_affixes.word_buile: mod模式+ule小→n.模数, 模块, 登月舱, 指令舱
com共同+mod模式+ity表名词→有共同的模式物品→商品
mod量度,方式,模式,风度+ulate=ate表动词→对模式进行调整→调整

stems_affixes.value_cn: 向……提供住处;对……予以照顾性考虑;符合
stems_affixes.word_buile: ac加强+com共同+mod量度,方式,模式,风度+ate表动词→方式相同→符合
mod量度,方式,模式,风度+ify……化→规范化→修改
re再+mod量度,方式,模式,风度+el→再造模型→重建

Sentence.sentence: Swedish family policies, by accommodating women's preferences effectively, are reducing the number of women in elite competitive positions.

sentences.en: Are there enough shelves to accommodate all our books?
sentences.cn: 有足够的书架容纳我们所有的书吗?

means.word_mean: 向…提供住处; 提供住宿（或膳宿、座位等）

sentences.cn: 这家旅馆可供600位来宾住宿。

means.word_mean: 使适应，使适合；使符合一致；调节；改变…以适应 (to)

sentences.en: This chair accommodates its shape to a person's position.
sentences.cn: 这把椅子的形状能随就座者的姿势而改变。

means.word_mean: 调解，调停(争端)，调和(分歧等)；在…之间消除纷争

sentences.en: to accommodate the dispute between the friends

means.word_mean: 通融，给(某人)提供方便，给(某人)以帮助，帮(某人)一个忙，施恩惠于 (with)

sentences.en: She will accommodate me with the use of her old car.
sentences.cn: 她会把她的旧汽车供我使用的。

sentences.en: He accommodated easily to the changed circumstances.
sentences.cn: 他容易适应变化了的环境。

means.word_mean: (眼)作调节，调节眼球的晶状体(使其变得适应不同距离的物体)

sentences.en: The lens of the eye accommodate to distance.
sentences.cn: 眼球晶状体能根据距离进行调节。

jushi.english: When we asked for help, a stranger accommodated us.
jushi.chinese: 当我们请求帮忙时,一位陌生人前来相助。

jushi.english: Should you have any special needs, our flight attendants will do their best to accommodate you.
jushi.chinese: 倘若你有任何特别的需要,我们的空中服务员会尽量给予协助。

jushi.english: Are there enough shelves to accommodate all our books?
jushi.chinese: 有足够的书架容纳我们所有的书吗?
